medical_history.chief_complaint: Axial hypotonia with poor head control and poor sucking at 5 days of life.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The mother noted significant differences in fetal movements during pregnancy, with one twin being barely noticeable. The patient was born with an Apgar score of 9 and showed persistence of hypotonia. Symptoms persisted with evaluations at 5 days revealing continued hypotonia, poor head control, and feeding difficulties.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Born following a dichorionic diamniotic twin pregnancy; routine fetal ultrasound showed intrauterine growth restriction in both fetuses.
